sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"考试"之意。
means: examination ： 通常指为检查学生知识或能力而举行的正式考试，有时也指临时考试。
test ： 多指有具体目的的临时性考试或小考。
quiz ： 指时间较短，随时进行的口头或书面的非正式测验。
exam系examination的缩略形式，口语用词，通俗。

sentence.Network_en: Below are printed the answers to the Brain of Soccer 1993 quiz.
sentence.Network_cn: 以下所印的是1993年“脑力足球”小测验的答案。

sentence.Network_en: We'll have a quiz at the end of the show.
sentence.Network_cn: 节目的最后我们要举行一次智力竞赛。

sentence.Network_en: We've also got a bonus quiz with crates of beer as prizes!
sentence.Network_cn: 我们还获得了一次参加有奖智力竞赛的机会，奖品是成箱的啤酒！

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent. (as a verb; originally US): possibly from quiz, influenced by inquisitive

late 18th cent.: sometimes said to have been invented by a Dublin theatre proprietor who, having made a bet that a nonsense word could be made known within 48 hours throughout the city, and that the public would give it a meaning, had the word written up on walls all over the city. There is no evidence to support this theory

encyclopedia.content: 《电子情迷》（quiz）是日本制作的精彩悬疑剧。剧情紧张，节奏紧凑。影片放映后在社会上产生极大的反响，成为当时社会热议话题。

entry.def: A quiz is a game or competition in which someone tests your knowledge by asking you questions.

example.ex: We'll have a quiz at the end of the show.
example.tran: 节目的最后我们要举行一次智力竞赛。

entry.def: If you are quizzed by someone about something, they ask you questions about it.

example.ex: He was quizzed about his income, debts and eligibility for state benefits...
example.tran: 他被问及收入、债务以及是否有资格享受政府发放的救济金等问题。

example.ex: Sybil quizzed her about life as a working girl.
example.tran: 西比尔询问了她当女工的生活。

means.word_mean: 1. an examination consisting of a few short questions

sentences.sentence: "We got quizzed on French irregular verbs"

auth_sentence.content: There is also a "man quiz" with questions on activities like fishing and hunting.
auth_sentence.res_content: There is also a "man quiz" with questions on activities like fishing and hunting.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is also a "man quiz" with questions on activities like fishing and hunting.

auth_sentence.content: POP QUIZ If I said Gandhi believed in God and he was an incredible person therefore God exists, what fallacy am I committing?

auth_sentence.res_content_con: POP QUIZ If I said Gandhi believed in God and he was an incredible person therefore God exists, what fallacy am I committing?

stems_affixes.value_cn: 想获得的,有获得可能性的,可学到的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ac不断+quis寻求,询问+itive……的→不断寻求的→想获得的
re再+quis寻求,询问+ite……的→一再寻求的→需要的
dis分开+quis寻求,询问+ition表名词→分开询问→到处问→探究
in进入+quis寻求,询问+ition表名词→问进去→调查,探究
re再+quis寻求,询问+ite……的→一再寻求的→需要的
quiz=quis寻求,询问→n.&v.测验, 提问
in进入+quis寻求,询问+ite表动词→问进去→调查,探究

sentences.cn: 他参加了一个电视知识竞赛并得了奖。

sentences.en: They are having a quiz now.
